results.title: In the service of Europe
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the importance of the Economic Council of Europe to every citizen of the 30 countries involved. It has stimulated and organised trade and promoted co-operation, through discussion, the interchange of ideas and assistance among the interdependent nations.

results.title: In the public interest
results.creator_credit: S M S Audiovisual, Victorian Film Corporation, Lindsay Parker and Colin Pym
results.brief_description: A film about the work of the Victorian Police and the various areas of involvement. Shown is the work of the Mounted Police in crowd control, the patrol cars, involvement in scenes of fires and burglaries, scientific investigation, the dog squad and boat patrol crews.

results.title: In the night kitchen
results.brief_description: With a musical score reminiscent of an old Laurel and Hardy movie, Maurice Sendak’s comic fantasy springs to life. Cake baking, bakers dancing and Mickey flying in his plane made of dough will delight children of all ages.

results.title: In the movies it doesn't hurt
results.creator_credit: Illustra Films, Barry Palin and Robert Young
results.brief_description: Made in a style similar to the “Carry on” movies, this very funny film shows what should and shouldn’t be done in a school laboratory. Sid James features in a film clip and cast also includes Bernard Bresslaw and John Merrigan. NB: Some equipment shown is not used in Australian schools. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: In the mood for love = Fa yeung nin wa [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Block 2 Pictures, Jet Tone Production, Paradis Films and Wong
results.brief_description: In 1962 Hong Kong, Chow (Tony Leung) and Li-zhen (Maggie Cheung) are neighbours. Their respective spouses are having an affair and the two lonely souls find themselves increasingly attracted to each other. But the morality of the times, and their own conflicted emotions, will not allow them to repeat the betrayals of their partners. On its release, “In the mood for love” singularly revitalised romanticism in film. An exquisite recreation of the Hong Kong of the early sixties is achieved through Kar-Wai concentrating on the colors and textures of cloth and surfaces; on the sound of rain and the rustle of bodies passing each other in narrow hallways. The film can be compared to a lyrical chamber piece where the direction of Kar-Wai, the luscious cinematography of Christopher Doyle, the musical score by Michael Galasso, the intimate performances of Cheung and Leung, and the stunning production design of William Chang Suk-Ping come together to form an astonishing powerful cinematic quintet. A love story that can justifiably be called timeless and mise-en-scene so romantic that it carries enormous emotion gravitas, this film has won awards throughout the globe (including Best Actor for Leung at Cannes as well as an outstanding technical achievement award for the combined talents of the filmmakers).

results.title: In the mind of the architect: ep. 3 : corrugated dream
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Tim Clark and Janne Ryan
results.brief_description: Part three of a three-part television documentary series about architecture and the way we interact with it. The series focuses on the work of a number of Australian architects with diverse styles and philosophies. Through interviews with these architects and the people that occupy the houses and public buildings they have designed, it investigates the passions, politics and creative vision that shape the final appearance of public and private spaces. Part three ‘Corrugated Dreams’, asks if there is a style of architecture that can be described as identifiably Australian. It looks at the work of architects like Harry Seidler and Glenn Murcutt which has often been regarded as conveying an Australian sensibility, as well that of architects who have reacted against the notion of an Australian style. Striking cinematography by Matt Temple brings the many examples of contemporary Australian architecture shown to life. With music by ‘The Necks’ and narration by David Wenham. An accompanying multimedia presentation to the series that features virtual tours of cutting-edge Australian architecture, transcripts and audio-visual slide show highlights of the programs can be found at: http://www.abc.net.au/architecture/default.html

results.title: In the mind of the architect. Ep. 3. Corrugated dreams
results.creator_credit: Tim Clark, Janne Ryan and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
A stylish exploration into the eclectic world of architects and their cutting edge creations. Concentrating on the views and motivations of several award-winning architects and a selection of their most remarkable and challenging projects, this series sets out to explain the process we call architecture - its philosophy and its essential relationship with people.
Music composed and performed by The Necks.
